title: [Large-Scale] Redesigning Social Studies Online Programs Based on Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational theories in social sciences and practical experience
context.additional_context: Social sector competency enhancement program for current practitioners, offering project-based assessments and digital device-integrated learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can apply a structured framework to analyze social issues in mobile environments with over 80% accuracy.

Learners can analyze team communication efficiency issues by incorporating peer feedback twice weekly and using Slack/Notion collaboration tools, then submit a problem definition document (1 page), collaboration roadmap (3-stage plan), and execution report (2 pages) by the deadline (Friday of Week 4, 18:00). The project deliverable must achieve an "Excellent" grade in four of five rubric items.
Learners can propose and evaluate at least three social conflict resolution strategies through situational simulation activities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
